On the history of the text, see Jean Jac­ quot, “Notes on an Unpublished Work of Thomas Hobbes,” Notes and Records of the Royal Society of London 9 (1952): 188–195 and Hobbes, Critique du De mundo, 12–13, 89–97. I have made my own emended translations from Hobbes’ Latin text, because I have reservations about Jones’ English version, and particularly about his translation of psychological terms (phantasma, imaginatio, imago and sensio). For a statement of Jones’ translation method­ ology see Hobbes, De mundo Examined, 17–18. 28 For White’s biography, see Beverly Southgate
